derivation: a primitive root to break off, i.e. (usually) plunder;
outline:
1. to cut off, break off, gain by unrighteous violence, get, finish, be covetous, be greedy
    1. (Qal)
      1. to cut off
      2. to stop
      3. to gain wrongfully or by violence
    2. (Piel)
      1. to cut off, sever
      2. to finish, complete, accomplish
      3. to violently make gain of
kjv_def: (be) covet(-ous), cut (off), finish, fulfill, gain (greedily), get, be given to (covetousness), greedy, perform, be wounded.
